instructions.display_text: Combine oats and water in a heatproof bowl and microwave for 1 minute. Then, stir and microwave for another minute.
Add protein and stir well
Add seeds, banana and strawberries.
Serve.
Shred kani sticks into thin strings
Place in a small bowl and mix with a squirt of each sauce
Spread kani sticks evenly on top of salmon.
Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes and allow to cool.
Thinly slice avocado and place neatly on salmon, then drizzle sauces as desired.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve.
Cut assorted veggies into bite size pieces.
Mix mayonnaise and sour cream together. Then, add in beau monde seasoning and dill.
Serve.
Mix flour and eggs together until sticky and dough-like. Then, add milk, ½ a cup at a time, until a batter forms.
Heat a pan or skillet on low to medium heat and cook pancakes, one at a time.
Top with syrup and serve.
Boil the milk, then add the macaroni. Stir it continuously for 10 minutes.
Then add cheese, salt and pepper.
Serve warm.

components.raw_text: 1 cup cheese (any variety - cheddar is our recommendation)

instructions.display_text: In a bowl, beat the whipping cream, sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, Whisk the milk and cookie crumbs until combined.
Pour into glasses (milk mixture, then whipped cream) and serve.

compilations.description: Sometimes you need a snack and you need it now! These easy snack recipes will satisfy all your cravings. If you're in the mood for something savory, you only need three ingredients and 20 minutes to make pigs in a blanket. On the sweet side, you can whip up a super easy chocolate-hazelnut mug cake in even less time, and right in the microwave.

compilations.description: Super hungry but too lazy to cook? These super easy snacks will keep all your hunger pangs at bay. From the easy chocolate hazelnut mug cakes to the filling mac n cheese, you can whip up these mouthwatering (and fool-proof!) snacks in no time.

compilations.name: Easy Mug Recipes For Lazy Cooks

instructions.display_text: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together ¾ cup (225 g) chocolate hazelnut spread and the eggs.
Fold in the flour.
Evenly distribute into two mugs.
Microwave each mug for 2 minutes.
Cool for 5 minutes.
Frost with remaining chocolate hazelnut spread and serve warm.
Enjoy!

If you're an egghead with a serious need for a quick, nourishing breakfast, our 3-minute mug omelet might be for you. But don't worry Team Sweet, we have your back with our fruity Chocolate Berry Mug Cake too! What are you waiting for? Power up the microwave and let's get 'cooking!'

instructions.display_text: Slice bread into cubes.
In a bowl, add egg, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla, and mix.
In a microwave-safe mug, place half of the cubed bread and desired amount of blueberries.
Place the rest of the bread, berries, and the egg mixture into the mug.
Microwave for 1½ minutes or until egg is fully cooked.
Drizzle maple syrup.
Enjoy!
Combine all ingredients in a microwaveable mug.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, making sure the egg doesn’t bubble over. Stir halfway through the cooking process.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: It may sound too good to be true, but you can actually make great food in just five minutes! The microwave is your best friend here – from this three-minute omelette in a mug (which you can customize with any add-ins you’d like) to this five-minute mac ’n’ cheese. With these recipes, lack of time will never be an excuse to eat a bag of chips instead of a full meal again.

You've been eating Instant Ramen for far, far too long, and, well, your body can't take it anymore. Luckily, these easy-to-make recipes are just what you (and your wallet) need. instructions.display_text: Slice bread into cubes.
In a bowl, add egg, milk, cheese, salt, and pepper, and mix.
In a microwave-safe mug, place half of the cubed bread and desired amount of spinach and red pepper.
Place the rest of the bread and fixins and pour the egg mixture into the mug.
Microwave for 1½ minutes or until egg is fully cooked.
Sprinkle with some tomatoes, if desired.
Enjoy!

recipes.description: Need pizza in a flash? Stuck in a dorm room with just a microwave? Feeling lazy? We have the perfect 60-second pizza recipe that tastes almost like the real thing. The secret? Canned biscuits!

instructions.display_text: Add the biscuit to a microwave-safe mug. MIcrowave for 30 seconds, until the biscuit starts to puff up.
In a small bowl, mix together the marinara sauce, garlic powder, and a pinch of basil.
Spoon the sauce over the par-cooked biscuit, then top with the mozzarella and mini pepperoni.
Loosely cover the mug with a paper towel and microwave for 30–45 seconds more, until the cheese is melted and the biscuit is cooked through.
Top with another pinch of basil, then let the mini pizza cool for about 5 minutes before serving.
Enjoy!

instructions.display_text: Add 3 tbs Marinara sauce, a handful of Mozzarella cheese and chopped fresh basil in a mug. Top with another 3 tbs Marinara sauce and the pre-cooked Rigatoni pasta.
Add some Parmesan cheese and then bake for 20 minutes at 400°F (205°C).
Enjoy in the mug itself or flip the pasta into a bowl and serve.
Enjoy!

instructions.display_text: Boil macaroni according to package directions. While it boils, in a separate pan on medium-heat, saute onions with salt until translucent. Then, add in garlic and grated potato and stir together.
Once the mixture is combined, add mustard, onion powder, garlic powder, chili flakes, and salt and stir.
If pasta has cooked through, drain and set aside, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Add the pasta water and cashews to the saute pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
After the mixture simmers and has combined together, add to a blender with the nutritional yeast and apple cider vinegar.
Blend the mixture on high until smooth and creamy. Once combined, season with salt and pepper to taste and add the sauce to the pasta. Stir to combine.
Taste and season if needed.
Serve warm.

results.description: Activate your superpowers with this Powerpuff Girls-inspired cocktail. For Bubbles, we made this drink featuring blue curaçao, ginger, beer and spiced rum, garnished with sweet cubed mango for a finishing touch.

instructions.display_text: Place the sugar in a shallow dish. Wet the rim of 2 glasses with a lime wedge or water and dip in the sugar to coat.
In a high-powered blender, combine the ice, ginger beer, blue curaçao, spiced rum, and simple syrup. Blend until smooth.
Divide the cocktail evenly between the rimmed glasses. Thread the cubed mango onto cocktail picks and garnish each drink.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: Powerpuff Girls-Inspired Drinks

results.name: Bubbles-Inspired Drink

instructions.display_text: Add the gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, rosewater, and egg whites to a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously for 30 seconds, until the ingredients are well incorporated. Fill the shaker with ice and shake for another 30 seconds, until the cocktail is very cold.
Strain the cocktail evenly between 2 martini or coupe glasses. Top with the hibiscus-flavored sparkling water and a drizzle of grenadine. Garnish with dried flowers.
Enjoy!

results.description: Everyone knows Blossom is the leader of the Powerpuff Girls pack. This sophisticated martini is packed with fruity and floral notes. Hibiscus-flavored seltzer gives the drink some fizz and rosewater adds a nice brightness. It’s finished with a drizzle of grenadine for a pop of pink.

compilations.name: Powerpuff Girls-Inspired Drinks

results.name: Blossom-Inspired Drink

components.raw_text: ¼ ounce rosewater or orange blossom water
2 ounces hibiscus-flavored sparkling water, such as LaCroix
Dried flowers, such as rose petals or hibiscus, for garnish
components.extra_comment: such as rose petals or hibiscus, for garnish

instructions.display_text: Add the sugar, black food coloring, and water to a shallow bowl and stir until well combined. Wet the rim of 2 glasses with the lime wedge, then dip in the black sugar mixture.
Add the honeydew, mint, and jalapeño to a high-powered blender and blend on high speed for 30 seconds, until smooth. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a cocktail shaker.
Add the lime juice, tequila, melon-flavored liqueur, and simple syrup to the cocktail shaker and fill the rest of the way with ice. Shake well to combine, about 30 seconds.
Strain the cocktail evenly between the rimmed glasses. Thread the honeydew melon balls onto cocktail picks and garnish each drink.
Enjoy!

results.name: Buttercup-Inspired Drink
results.description: For this spicy and sweet Powerpuff Girls-inspired cocktail, we blended up a fresh juice with honeydew melon, mint, and jalapeño that’s shaken with lime juice, tequila, melon-flavored liqueur, and some simple syrup. It’s sweet with a little kick of heat, just like Buttercup!

instructions.display_text: Put the pasta into a saucepan and pour over one tablespoon of chosen oil to stop the pasta from clumping together. Add the vegetable stock cube to the boiling water and stir until dissolved then pour the water over the pasta and bring to a boil. Cook the pasta until just undercooked and drain the pasta water, saving about a cupful of the water for the sauce.

Into the pan of cooked pasta, add the tin of tomatoes, the tuna, the butter, crushed garlic, paprika, salt and pepper to taste and chili flakes. Stir and bring to a simmer to finish cooking the pasta.

Add the pasta water saved previously and stir in whilst still simmering, then add the cheese in and stir this in. Simmer until the cheese has melted and then serve, adding more cheese, black pepper and chili flakes if needed.

components.raw_text: 1 leek, sliced into thin half moons
Hot pepper sauce to serve, if you like spice!

results.name: Ackee Scramble

instructions.display_text: Saute leek in butter for 8-10 mins until caramelised
Add pepper and cook for 4 mins until soft and Add chilli & garlic, season with salt & pepper
Add the ackee and cook for a couple of minutes until warmed through, being careful not to break it up too much
Pop a lid on to keep warm whilst you make the fried bread
Butter bread on both sides and pop into a pan over a medium-low heat with a splash of olive oil.
Cook on medium-low until golden brown, flip and cook the other side.
Top bread with the scramble, garnish with parsley and spring onion, and a splash of hot sauce, if desired.

instructions.display_text: Cook noodles according to package directions. Once cooked. Drain and add oil to prevent noodles from sticking together.
In a wok on medium-heat, saute garlic until fragrant. Then, add onions, bell pepper, and green onions and saute until fried and golden brown.
Add soy sauce and vinegar. Then, add noodles and mix well to combine.
Season to taste and serve.

components.raw_text: 2 tsp salt or as per taste
2 flax-eggs (2 tablespoons ground flax + 6 tbsp water, whisked together, set for 15 minutes)
components.extra_comment: (2 tablespoons ground flax + 6 tbsp water, whisked together, set for 15 minutes)

results.name: Vegan Rose White Chocolate Chip Oats Cookies

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set it aside.
Whisk together all of the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl: oat flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate, large mixing bowl, combine the wet ingredients: coconut oil, coconut sugar, maple syrup, flax eggs, and rose water and mix until thoroughly combined.
Combine the dry and wet ingredients in a mixing bowl. Whisk until everything is well mixed. Stir in the chocolate chips and rose petals.
Cover the cookie dough bowl. Allow to remain at room temperature for 10 minutes to allow the dry mixture to absorb the liquid mixture.

Scoop about 2 teaspoons of cookie dough onto the baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Use your palm to softly flatten the cookies into a circular disc, they will not spread while baking. Chocolate chips can be pressed into the tops of the cookies if desired.

Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until lightly golden brown and set. With a flat, heatproof spatula, remove the cookies from the baking sheet and set them on a cooling rack to cool. Allow to thoroughly cool and serve.
In a large bowl, cream the butter, sugar, and brown sugar until creamy. While mixing, add eggs, one-by-one.
Next, add dry ingredients. Once combined, stir in chocolate chips.
Shape cookie dough into round balls (each the size of a golf ball) and refrigerate the dough overnight.
Preheat the oven to 415* F. Retrieve the dough from the fridge, thaw, and bake the cookies, 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned and set.
Cool on a wire rack and serve.

components.raw_text: ½ cup of dark brown sugar
Juice of ½ of a lime (+ more to taste if needed)
components.extra_comment: (+ more to taste if needed), juiced
spiralized, (or sliced lengthwise into noodle-like strands)
components.raw_text: 1 large of 2 small zucchinis, spiralized (or sliced lengthwise into noodle-like strands)
2 ears corn, grilled and cut off the cob

results.name: Grilled Corn And Zoodle Salad With Avocado-Yogurt Sauce

instructions.display_text: For the sauce:
Put all of the ingredients in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
Add more lime juice and salt to taste (if needed).
For the salad:
Toss the zucchini noodles, corn kernels, tomatoes, scallions, and cheese with the sauce.
Sprinkle extra cheese and scallions on top.
Serve with grilled chicken or fish and some crunchy tortilla chips.
Crush all the biscuits and add 1 tablespoon condensed milk and mix. Then, keep on adding condensed milk till it forms a dough.
Form the dough into small balls and freeze them for 1 hour.
Once frozen, dip each ball into the remaining condensed milk and cover in sprinkles. Repeat until all truffles are covered.
Freeze for an hour, then serve.
Shallow-fry paneer on a simple grill pan. Then, add paneer to a bowl and coat with salt, red chili powder, and Chaat masala.
In another bowl, mix potato, green chili, black salt, lemon juice from ½ of a lemon, finely-chopped onions, pani puri masala, jeera, chopped coriander, and chopped mint. Mix well.
Place a slab of potato mixture between two slices of paneer and pan-fry the ‘sandwich’ on the same nonstick skillet.
Garnish with boondhi, chopped red onions, and remaining lemon juice. Serve.

results.name: Italian Chopped Salad
results.description: All of your favorite Italian flavors are chopped together in this hearty salad. Full of tender and bitter greens, hearty protein from salami and chickpeas, and flavor boosters like Provolone, pepperoncini, and a garlicky vinaigrette, it’s satisfying enough to stand alone, or can be served alongside your favorite dishes for an Italian feast.
results.seo_title: Italian Chopped Salad Recipe by Tasty

components.raw_text: 1 small head of radicchio, thinly sliced

ingredient.display_plural: small heads of radicchio, thinly sliced
ingredient.name: small head of radicchio, thinly sliced
ingredient.display_singular: small head of radicchio, thinly sliced

components.raw_text: ½ cup thinly sliced Provolone cheese
1 15-ounce can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed

ingredient.name: 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
ingredient.display_singular: 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
ingredient.display_plural: 1 cans of chickpeas, drained and rinsed

components.raw_text: ½ medium red onion, thinly sliced
½ cup finely grated Parmesan cheese

instructions.display_text: Make the salad: In a large bowl, toss together the romaine, radicchio, salami, Provolone, tomatoes, chickpeas, red onion, and pepperoncini.

Make the vinaigrette: In a small bowl or glass measuring cup, whisk together the garlic, mustard, Parmesan, vinegar, salt, pepper, and oregano. Slowly pour in the olive oil, whisking until smooth and emulsified.
Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss to coat.
Enjoy!
